citeinfo.origin: U.S. Geological Survey (USGS), Earth Sciences Information Center (ESIC)
citeinfo.title: USGS Digital Line Graphs

descript.abstract: Data Type: Base Maps ;Digital Line Graph (DLG) data are digital representations of cartographic information. DLG's of topographic and planimetric map features are derived from cartographic source materials using manual and automated digitizing methods. The USGS DLG data is classified as large (1:63,360) intermediate (1:1,000,000), and small (1:2,000,000) scale. Large-scale DLG data are available in nine categories: 1. hypsography, 2. hydrography, 3. vegetative surface cover, 4. non-vegetative features; 5. boundaries; 6. survey control markers; 7. transportation systems 8. manmade features, and 9. US Public Land Survey System, including township, range, and section information. Intermediate-scale DLG's are sold in five categories: 1. Public Land survey, 2. boundaries, 3. transportation 4. hydrography, and 5. hypsography. Small-scale DLG data are sold in three data categories: 1. boundaries; 2. transportation; 3. hydrography. All of these categories are also included on a 1:2,000,000-scale CD-ROM.

idinfo.useconst: None, request that USGS be noted as data source.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
